org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi
Class JNDISearch

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi.JNDISearch
public class JNDISearch
extends java.lang.Object

Class to provide a bean-esque wrapping around a JNDI search configuration.

Notes: It differs from a vanilla JNDI search as follows:

  • A search may configured against multiple search bases. The actual search will execute against each, in order, and consolidate the results.
  • The dn of each object found in a search may be included as an attribute of the object itself, by assigning an attribute name via the returnedDNAttribute property. Note that behaviour is undefined if the chosen name conflicts with an existing attribute of the object.
  • Retrieved multi-valued attributes can be treated in two ways - by retrieving the first value of the attribute, or by returning an array containing all of the values. This behaviour is configured via the treatMultiValuedAttributesAsArray property.

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Field Detail

_searchBases

protected java.lang.String[] _searchBases
List of Search bases to apply searches against.

(Note that they will be searched in order)

_filter

protected java.lang.String _filter
Search filter to be applied in searches.

_attributes

protected java.lang.String[] _attributes
Optional list of attributes to return.

returnedDNAttributeName

protected java.lang.String returnedDNAttributeName
If set, Each result from a search will contain an attribute with this name, containing the dn of the object. If this is not desired, just leave it as null (the default).

searchControls

protected javax.naming.directory.SearchControls searchControls
SearchControls to govern the search.

joinArraysWithSeparator

protected java.lang.String joinArraysWithSeparator
If set and multi-valued attributes are being returned as arrays, it will join each multi-valued attribute array into a single string using this string to separate each value. By default we do not join arrays.

Constructor Detail

JNDISearch

public JNDISearch()
Default constructor for a JNDI Search.

Will default to having a default SearchControls instance - as returned by new SearchControls() Will also default to use the first value of multi-valued attributes.

Method Detail

setSearchBases

public void setSearchBases(java.lang.String[] searchBases)
An array of search bases to search.

These will be searched, in order, and all matching entries will be returned as a consolidated enumeration of matches.

Parameters:
searchBases - A String[] of search bases to use.

getSearchBases

public java.lang.String[] getSearchBases()
Retrieve the current list of search bases to use.

Returns:
String[] of searchBases.

Set the filter to apply to searches.

Parameters:
filter - String containing a filter definition

getFilter

public java.lang.String getFilter()
Returns the current filter, if any which will be applied to searches.

Returns:
String containing the filter, or null if none is defined.

setReturnedDNAttributeName

public void setReturnedDNAttributeName(java.lang.String returnedDNAttributeName)
Set the name of the attribute which will contain the dn of each object returned as a result of search execution.

If null, the dn will not be included as an attribute at all.

Parameters:
returnedDNAttributeName - Name of the attribute to hold the dn.

getReturnedDNAttributeName

public java.lang.String getReturnedDNAttributeName()
Get the name, if any of the attribute which will be used to hold dn values within search results.

The default value is null, i.e. do not return the dn as an attribute.

Returns:
String containing the attribute name, or null

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(java.lang.String[] attributes)
Set the list of attributes to return for matching search results.

If set, then searches will return those attribute specified here.

Parameters:
attributes - String[] containing attribute names.

getAttributes

public java.lang.String[] getAttributes()
Get the list of attributes to return for matching search results.

If set, then searches will return those specified attributes.

Returns:
String[] containing attribute names.

setSearchControls

public void setSearchControls(javax.naming.directory.SearchControls searchControls)
Assign a SearchControls instance to use for searches.

Parameters:
searchControls - the searchControls to use. Should not be null

for more info.

getSearchControls

public javax.naming.directory.SearchControls getSearchControls()
Retrieve the current SearchControls instance which this search will use.

Returns:
SearchControls instance.

setTreatMultiValuedAttributesAsArray

public void setTreatMultiValuedAttributesAsArray(boolean asArray)
If true then multi-valued attributes will be returned as an array of values. If false then the first retrieved attribute value of multi-valued attributes will be returned. All other values will be discarded.

The default value is false

Parameters:
asArray - boolean flag

getTreatMultiValuedAttributesAsArray

public boolean getTreatMultiValuedAttributesAsArray()
If true then multi-valued attributes will be returned as an array of values. If false then the first retrieved attribute value of multi-valued attributes will be returned. All other values will be discarded.

The default value is false

setJoinArraysWithSeparator

public void setJoinArraysWithSeparator(java.lang.String valueSeparator)

The default value is null

Parameters:
valueSeparator - String to use as separator for concatenating multiple values into single String (null means return multiple values as a String[]).

getJoinArraysWithSeparator

public java.lang.String getJoinArraysWithSeparator()
If true then multi-valued attributes will be returned as an array of values. If false then the first retrieved attribute value of multi-valued attributes will be returned. All other values will be discarded.

The default value is null which means return multiple values as a String[].

execute

public javax.naming.NamingEnumeration execute(javax.naming.directory.DirContext context)
                                       throws javax.naming.NamingException
Execute this search against a DirContext.

The search will be run against each configured searchBase in turn, returning a NamingEnumeration will all of the matching entries the search yields.

Parameters:
context - a DirContext against which the search is to be executed.
Returns:
NamingEnumeration This will contain all matching entries found.
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - If searchBases does not contain at least one search base, or if the search fails for any reason.
